title: Advanced Settings
description: Fine-tune poll behavior with advanced options

content.text: Configure how voters interact with your poll.
Allow Vote Change
Default: ON. When enabled, voters can change or retract their votes anytime.

items: Voters can switch to a different option
Click the same option again to retract
Useful when opinions may evolve

content.text: When disabled: First vote is final, no changes allowed.
Show Live Results
Default: ON. When enabled, results update in real-time with each vote.

items: Bar charts refresh immediately
Voters see current vote distribution
Creates transparency and engagement

content.text: When disabled: Results hidden until poll closes.

items: Prevents bandwagon effects
Useful for sensitive decisions
Results revealed when poll closes

content.text: Anonymous Voting
Default: OFF. When enabled, voter identities are hidden from all results.

items: Only vote counts shown, no names
Voter IDs stored for deduplication
Creator cannot see who voted for what
Perfect for sensitive feedback or decisions

content.text: Allow Adding Options
Available for single choice and multi-select polls only. When enabled, voters can suggest new options.

items: An 'Add Option' button appears on the poll
Voters click it to suggest a new choice
New options are added to the poll immediately
Useful when the creator might miss options

content.text: Voter-added options show which user suggested them. All voters can then vote on the new option.
Send Reminders
Default: OFF. When enabled, Askify DMs non-voters before the poll closes.

items: Sent 1 hour before close (short polls) or 24 hours (long polls)
Only sent to channel members who haven't voted
Includes a link back to the poll
One reminder per user per poll

content.text: Reminders require an auto-close setting (duration or date/time). They won't send for manual-close polls.
Add optional context or instructions below your poll question.

items: Multiline text field in poll creation modal
Displays below the question in the poll message
Included in results DM and shared results
Saved in templates for reuse

content.text: Use descriptions to:

items: Provide context or background
Explain option meanings
Give voting instructions
Link to related documents

content.text: Use Slack emoji codes in poll questions and options.

content.value:
Examples:
:fire: Hot Topic
:rocket: Launch Day
:pizza: Team Lunch

content.text: Emoji codes are automatically rendered as emoji in Slack:

items: Use :emoji_name: syntax
Works in questions, options, and descriptions
All Slack emoji codes supported
Custom workspace emoji also work
